page.title: 19UNIVERSITY NATURE TRAIL
page.content: In 1985 the University of Kent at Canterbury opened a Nature Trail around the 300 acre campus overlooking the Stour valley and the Cathedral City of Canterbury. It takes 2 to 3 hours to walk the Trail. There are 4 main habitats, woodland grassland wetland & buildings. There are nightingales willow-warblersand great spotted wood- peckers...In the ponds are 3 spined sticklebacks, palmate and smooth newts, dragonflies and frogs. There are 21 species of butterfly. The Trail starts at the entrance to the 12'x12' tunnel of the historic 1830 "Crab and Winkle" railway line, now dismantled, which used to run between Canterbury and Whitstable, and finishes in the woodlands looking down to the Sarre Penn stream valley to the South of Tyler Hill.
